item.title: Sanskrit 2012
item.dc:creator: Andrew Ollett
item.description: This January, roughly 2,300 years after the composition of Pāṇini’s definitive Sanskrit grammar, scholars congregated in New Delhi to present papers on the massive and enduring cultural system represented by the language. The World Sanskrit Conference, a triennial event that brings together two worlds: one in which Sanskrit serves as the language of imagining truth, beauty and power, and … Continue reading Sanskrit 2012 →
